udpp.UDPPFFunctionCollection.UDPFFunctionCollection

class udpp.UDPPFFunctionCollection.UDPFFunctionCollection

This class only includes static methods which are able to used in a user defined pipeline

static concat_readings(set_a: [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>], set_b: [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>]) → [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>]

Concat two readings array into one. Can be used for combining readings from two folders using the import_readings function

Parameters:

  • set_a ([MRPReading.MRPReading]) – first array of readings

  • set_b ([MRPReading.MRPReading]) – second array of readings

Returns:

both readings arrays combined

Return type:

[MRPReading.MRPReading]

static import_readings(input_folder: str = '', file_regex: str = '(.)*.mag.json') → [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>]

Imports all readings found in the folder given from the input_folder. It restores all meta-data and datapoints.

Parameters:

  • input_folder (str) – Folder with .mag.json readings ABS or REL-Paths are allowed

  • file_regex (str) – to only allow certain filenames using a regex string

Returns:

Returns the imported readings as [MRPReading.MRPReading] instances

Return type:

[MRPReading.MRPReading]

static inspect_readings(readings: [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>])

prints some information about a set of readings

Parameters:

readings ([MRPReading.MRPReading]) – readings to inspect

static readings_passthrough(readings: [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>]) → [<class 'MRP.MRPReading.MRPReading'>]

returns the input readings without any modification. implemented and used during development

Parameters:

readings ([MRPReading.MRPReading]) – input readings

Returns:

returns same readings as given in the readings input parameter

Return type:

[MRPReading.MRPReading]
